page.title: 13The Village Institute.
page.content: The instititute at Coddington is alongside the church and was once a school,being enlarged by an endownment in the will of T.Sandbach in 1887. The building is now used by the Women's Institute where 20 members meet twice monthly. About 60 people play Bingo once a month and a Whist Drive is also held monthly. Occasional use of the institute is made by young farmers and the gardening club and it is used as a Polling Station.The church committee meets in the building and the institute will be used for services whilst the church is being repaired. Recent fund raising has paid for central heating etc.and it is now more attractive for public use.
